Header.title: Coffee production AI Prediction site
Header.paragraph: This site is used for prediction of coffee production in Ethiopia for consecutive years

About.paragraph: we used the publicly available data gathered by the Ethiopian Commodity Exchange(ECX). It is a marketplace, where buyers and sellers come together to trade, assured of quality, delivery and payment. The data is available publicly on their website in the form of a spreadsheet and it suits the requirements we need for the project.

Features.title: Yirgacheffe
Features.text: Yirgacheffe coffee is a wet processed coffee grown at elevations from 1,700 to 2,200 meters above sea level, and is the considered the best high grown coffee in southern Ethiopia, an exotic coffee region known for fine coffees.

Features.title: Sidamo
Features.text: A large area in the fertile highlands in the Rift Valley, Sidamo is one of three trademarked coffee regions in Ethiopia (along with Harrar and Yirgacheffe). Itâ€™s 1,550 to 2,200 m.a.s.l and has ample rainfall, optimum temperatures, and fertile soil.

Features.title: Harar
Features.text: This is a wild Arabica that is grown on small farms in the Oromia region (formerly Harrar) at elevations between 1,400 and 2,000 metres. It is typically natural processed.

Features.title: Limu
Features.text: Limu coffee grows in the southwest of Ethiopia at between 1,100 to 1,900 m.a.s.l. A washed coffee with relatively low acidity, it has a well-balanced body and a distinct spicy flavour that is pleasantly sweet and often has floral notes.

Features.title: Jimma
Features.text: This region in the southwest of Ethiopia is a large producer of commercial-grade coffee. It grows at an altitude of 1,400 to 2,100 m.a.s.l. Also spelled as Djimmah, coffees from this region are reportedly best when washed and can take on a medicinal flavour if natural processed.
